Articles.Content: When I fly my planes my wheels start to bounce my damper strength and my spring strength are at max but still it bounces?

Assuming you're talking about when they're on the ground,then I find that actually lowering those settings can help to reduce bouncing. I haven't found a reliable method of eliminating it though.

 

If they're bouncing around while you are actually flying in the air, then I have no idea what to tell you.

on ground...

That's the problem right there! You've got your landing gears set to being virtual blocks.

Try setting spring strength to about 1.1 and damper to .90 or there about, depends on the weight.

On trains i generally maxout all settings..suspension still works but light engine jumps around in the yard

 

Does anyone have any definate guide as to what the sliders do at what setting?

Having to reload a mission to test a setting is bloody madness

They also got rid of my lateral slip setting in the cfg files that used to make wagons track straighter at speed

AFAIK "Lateral Slip" is the "Traction" slider once you choose the override.

I also wish for a guide to optimizing wheel settings, but one thing I found - too few, too small wheels under too high load (mass) will bounce.

Trucky used to jump around too, until I added one more axis.

I mean - first, I tried this setup, except with cargo intended for the mission. It behaved okay at 1x, but 2x phys-warp would make it jump shamelessly.

Adding an extra pair of wheels makes Trucky behave quite correctly under 3x phys warp. It still jumps at x4 though.

The wheels have been driving me crazy ever since the "fix" as well. The only reliable solution seems to be making sure they're 100% absolutely and perfectly aligned forward and horizontally - no matter whether it makes your vehicle ugly - and making the vehicle heavy enough to absorb the rebound forces. One might guess that I find the situation hacky and limiting.
